item.title: 11 benefits to practicing metta
item.description: (loving-kindness) meditation / prayer: You will sleep easily You will wake easily You will have pleasant dreams People will love you Devas (gods or angels) and animals will love you Devas will protect you External dangers, such as poisons, weapons, and fire, will not harm you Your face will be radiant Your mind will be serene You will die unconfused You will be re-born in happy realms (from Anguttara Nikaya 11.

item.title: 11 obstructions
item.description: to spiritual growth for a monk: There is the case where a monk is not well-versed in forms. He is unskilled in characteristics.

item.title: 11 things for energy to grow
item.description: Reflection on the long-term dangers of inactivity such as rebirth to a woeful state Reviewing the benefits to be gained by energetic praxis Remembering that no journey can ever be ended by a lazy one Giving credit to the good givers of the alms-food received Honoring the greatness of the prior effort of the Master Honoring the greatness of the prior effort of the lineage Removing laxity by perceiving light, change posture and open air Avoidance of slack, lazy, sluggish, negligent and careless people Friendship with enthusiastic, energetic and persistent people Reviewing the four right efforts often and systematically Commitment and resolute determination to arouse more energy (from Samyutta Nikaya 46)

item.title: 11 things for joy to grow
item.description: : 1. Recollection of the supreme and sublime uniqueness of the Buddha. 2. Recollection of the supreme and sublime uniqueness of the Dhamma.
